info.title: trackmatic
info.description: This is the API documentation for the Trackmatic server.

get.description: Listing all the resolved contacts with pagination (Page size = 15). Resolved contacts are the ones with a value for identifier, email or phone number
Get a contact belonging to the account using ID

put.description: Update a contact belonging to the account using ID

delete.description: Delete a contact belonging to the account using ID

get.description: Get conversations associated with that contact
Search the resolved contacts using a search key, currently supports email search (Page size = 15). Resolved contacts are the ones with a value for identifier, email or phone number

post.description: Filter contacts with custom filter options and pagination

values.description: array of the attribute values to filter

get.description: Get open, unassigned and all Conversation counts

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filters conversations with messages containing the search term

get.description: List all the conversations with pagination

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Filters conversations with messages containing the search term

post.description: Creating a conversation in trackmatic requires a source id
Filter conversations with custom filter options and pagination

values.description: array of the attribute values to filter

get.description: Get all details regarding a conversation with all messages in the conversation

sla_policy_id.description: The ID of the SLA policy (Available only in Enterprise edition)

post.description:
Toggle the status of a conversation. Pass `status` to explicitly set the
conversation state. Use `snoozed` along with `snoozed_until` to snooze a
conversation until a specific time. If `snoozed_until` is omitted, the
conversation is snoozed until the next reply from the contact. Regardless
of the value provided, snoozed conversations always reopen on the next
reply from the contact.

snoozed_until.description: When status is `snoozed`, schedule the reopen time as a Unix timestamp in seconds. If not provided, the conversation is snoozed until the next customer reply. The conversation always reopens when the customer replies.

post.description: Updates the custom attributes of a conversation

custom_attributes.description: The custom attributes to be set for the conversation
The custom attributes of the conversation

post.description: Assign a conversation to an agent or a team

team_id.description: Id of the team. If the assignee_id is present, this param would be ignored

get.description: Lists all the labels of a conversation

post.description: Add labels to a conversation. Note that this API would overwrite the existing list of labels associated to the conversation.

get.description: List all messages of a conversation

delete.description: Delete a message and it's attachments from the conversation.

404.description: The message or conversation does not exist in the account

parameters.description: The Id of specific object in case of agent/inbox/label

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should start.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The timestamp from where report should stop.

userApiKey.name: api-access-token
userApiKey.description: This token can be obtained via the UI. Provides access to endpoints based on the user's permission levels.

agentBotApiKey.name: api-access-token
agentBotApiKey.description: This token should be provided by the system admin. This token can be used to build bot integrations and can only access limited APIs.

platformAppApiKey.name: api-access-token
platformAppApiKey.description: This token can be obtained by the system admin after creating a platformApp. This token should be used to provision agent bots, accounts, users and their roles.
